    • Method Detail

      • open

        Segment open​(java.lang.String id)
      throws java.io.IOException
        Return the named segment that the generator can write. Return null if there is no such segment in the file.
        Parameters:
        id - the name of the segment as defined in the id="..." xml tag of the <editor-fold ...>
        Returns:
        the segment or null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case there is no file or file is not readable

      • open

        Segment open()
        Open the "global" segment that is the whole source file. Usually used on sources that are created calling newSource(String)
        Returns:
        the new segment object.

      • getLines

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLines()
        Generators can use this method to read the whole content of a file. The content of the list should not be modified and should be treated as immutable.
        Returns:
        the list of the strings that contain the lines of the source file.

      • getAbsoluteFile

        java.lang.String getAbsoluteFile()
        Get the absolute file name of this source.
        Returns:
        the absolute file name of the source

      • newSource

        Source newSource​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Create a new source that may or may not exist. This source is going to be generated and if it already existed it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        fileName - relative file name to the current source.
        Returns:
        the new Source object.

      • newSource

        Source newSource​(Source.Set set,
                 java.lang.String fileName)
        Create a new source that may or may not exist. This source is going to be generated and if it already existed it will be overwritten. Create the new source file in the directory that was used to open the specified source set.
        Parameters:
        fileName - relative file name to the current source.
        set - identifies the source set with a name
        Returns:
        the new Source object.

      • init

        void init​(java.lang.String id)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize a segment. This is needed in case it is possible that the code generator does not write anything into the segment. In that case the segment may not even be opened and in that case the segment is not touched and the old text, presumably garbage may be there. For example, you have a setter/getter generated code that selects some of the fields only, say only the 'protected' fields. During the development you change the last 'protected' field to private and there remains no field for which setter and getter is to be generated. If the segment is not init-ed, then the code generator would not touch the segment and it may contain the setter and the getter for the last 'protected' by now 'private' field.

        Technically calling init is similar to opening a segment, though init should be more lenient to opening non-existent segments.

        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the segment. May be null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case there is no file or file is not readable

      • getKlassName

        java.lang.String getKlassName()
        Get the name of the class that corresponds to this source. The class may not exist though.

        When calculating the class name the directory structure is used and the name of the source file chopping off the .java or other extension. This results a class name that either

        Returns:
        the class name that was calculated from the file name

      • getKlassSimpleName

        java.lang.String getKlassSimpleName()
        Get the calculated class simple name. That is the name of the class without the package name in front of it.
        Returns:
        the simple name of the class

      • getPackageName

        java.lang.String getPackageName()
        Get the name of the class where the class corresponding to the source is or should be.
        Returns:
        the name of the package

      • getKlass

        java.lang.Class<?> getKlass()
        Get the class that corresponds to this source. If the class does not exists, either because the source file is not a Java source or because the file was not compiled or just for any reason then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        the class object or null

        static Source.Maven maven()
